intro: Pedatyphonium kunmingense, commonly known as the Kunming pedatyphonium, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
